item.title: Pandemic rules for grad student housing are driving me off-campus
item.author: Author
item.description: MIT recently asked on-campus residents to re-sign their license agreement because of changes to housing policy related to the pandemic. And after reading the fine print, I am seriously considering not re-signing. Even though I got my first choice for on-campus housing, I plan to try and move off-campus if I can. It makes sense that universities need to make some changes to keep their communities safe in light of COVID-19, but the rules MIT is putting in place for grad housing go beyond what I expected.

item.title: Visiting my boyfriend is not tourism
item.author: Author
item.description: As pandemic lockdown measures ease and borders begin to slowly reopen, rarely do policymakers seem to recognize any distinction between seeing loved ones and seeing sights. Those hoping to reunite with anyone who isn’t their spouse or minor child will likely need to wait for tourism from their country to be given the green light.
